page.title: 05 Town Roads
page.content: Deep potholes have been a problem following the severe winter frosts of Jan/Feb 1985. We are writing this in June, and work is still going on to repair the roads. It will take many years before the problem of our narrow town roads can be solved. An experiment was tried recently to have a one-way system, but it was unpopular as people had to drive further to reach nearby destinations. Parked cars seriously obstruct the roads, so in some places it is impossible for two vehicles to pass each other. It is easier to get around the town on a bycycle rather than in a car. At school children take the cycling proficiency test, learning to ride a bike correctly.Traffic signs and signals form part of the test, as well as hints on keeping cycles in good condition and roadworthy.
